alert.note: Alert for Garfield; Iron; Kane; Piute; Sevier (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 14 at 12:00PM MDT until further notice by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Utah... South Fork of The Ogden River Near Huntsville affecting Weber County. Sevier River Near Hatch affecting Piute, Sevier, Kane, Garfield and Iron Counties. .Snow melt and increased reservoir releases will cause the river flows to become high. Expect minor flooding downstream from the dam. Minor flooding is ongoing along the South Fork of the Ogden River near Huntsville, and along the Bear River near Corinne. For the Sevier River...including Hatch...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast by Wednesday, May 17. * WHERE...Sevier River Near Hatch. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 3.9 feet (1046 CFS), minor flooding will affect fields near and downstream of the river gage. Assorted bridges and select low lying structures will receive minor flood damage. At 4.3 feet (1353 CFS), moderate flooding will affect fields, roads and bridges along low lying stretches of the Sevier River. Additionally, structures in low lying areas will receive flood damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM MDT Sunday the stage was 3.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:15 AM MDT Sunday was 4.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will remain above action stage to near flood stage through the weekend before rising steadily through minor flood stage early next week, with Moderate flooding forecast by Wednesday, May 17. - Flood stage is 3.9 feet (1046 cfs). &&
info.instruction: Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by 1200 MDT on Monday.
